instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.D7105: What is D7105? Diodes between PPDCIN_G3H charger voltage and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, when CHGR_DCIN Is low(less than charger voltage) and PPBUS_G3H is missing this is a critical point to troubleshoot.
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.CHGR_PHASE: What is CHGR_PHASE? CHGR_PHASE is charger voltage chopped up into individual slices prior to smoothing where it becomes PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
820-000165 with no liquid damage wont turn on. All power rails good up to P3V3S3 which is only 0.12V checked for shorts on both rails are not shorted. I see <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is responsible for P3V3S3 I have 0V on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> but no shorts on either rail.

What to check next???

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: When checking pin 9 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> noticed it was worked on before and was only getting 0.34V so changed ISL but in process the board made a snap noise and I now have a short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. With all caps and ISL removed the short still remains. Is this a internal short at this point from using to much heat?

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Remove F7140 and see where the short remains.
Which exact value (ohm scale) has that short?

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
with F1740 starts at  0.10ohm and continuous climes to a higher number 1 by 1 every few seconds

without 0.395

checked everything with F7140 removed and short doesn't appear anywhere anymore. As soon as F1740 is back on o.10ohm and climbing returns. Tried different fuse but same result

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: current voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.272V

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
If you really have short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, it MUST be present in one pad of F7140, once removed...
Disconnect charger and battery, when check diode mode, or ohm scale...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
0.90 with F7140 abnd 0.359 with removed.

W

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
0.90 with F7140 and 0.390 with it removed. Assuming I don't have a short at all now.

What to check next? <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> only 0.272V already replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
F7140 has two pads.
So if removed, you MUST get two different readings; for each pad.
And you should get higher values without fuse; this depends by measuring pad too.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Are you measuring in diode mode or resistance mode? Try resistance to ground on pins 1 and 2 of the fuse

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
With F7140 pad 1 0.135  pad 2 0.135

Without F7140 pad 1 0.014  pad 2 0.420

diode mode

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: We asked resistance not diode mode. However, that is not good on pin 1 so you have a short on pin one side of PPBUS more than likely.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
You do something wrong.
Cannot get lower reading without the fuse.
However, 135 (diode mode) is correct value.
No need to remove fuse then.
All I told to do is because you wrongly assumed a short there.

Be sure <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> is properly soldered and post some voltages; 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Pin 3 had a short so replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and afterwards was  0.10V on pin 3 but 5V on pad one on <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> for a short bit and now 0V again and short returned.

This is the 3rd ISL 6259 I have replaced on this board now.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> once again now 4.87V on <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> but only 0.15V  on the actual pin 3 of the ISL. My soldering is fine and traces look fine, no liquid damage on this board.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Short again on <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. What to check to see what keeps shorting it? Already replaced <DIODE>D7105</DIODE> <RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> <CAPACITOR>C7105</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> <RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7186</RESISTOR>  <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>  <CAPACITOR>C7185</CAPACITOR>

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Sounds like a corroded trace or bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>. Try replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> at the same time.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Please, specify where the short is; and post the ohm value.
You must get aprox 4V on ACIN pin of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Check the trace from pin3 to <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>/11; with multimeter, not the eye!

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
short was on pin 3 and 0.5 ohm

replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and ISL at same time and so far short has not returned.

Only 2.5v and fluctuates down to 0.500V and back to 2.5V on pin 3. Ran jumper to rule out trace issue

Also still only 17.5V on pad 2 of  <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7185</CAPACITOR> but both have 18.5v on pad 1.

<RESISTOR>R7186</RESISTOR> only 17.75V on pad 1 and 2

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Looks like leakage issue.
Charger detects it and get blocked and tries again and again.
3V42 also pulsing?

Try with fake charger, or bench power supply, using 60/85W power cable.

"Also still only 17.5V on pad 2 of <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7185</CAPACITOR> but both have 18.5v on pad 1."
Mmmh, then no leakage, if stable <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Remove <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> and check again ACIN level.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
3v42 is fine at a steady 3.4V

I have been using bench power supply with 85 watt cable the whole time

With <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> removed there is still a leakage issue on ACIN. voltage ranges from 0.100V to 2.5V to  3.4V

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Board draws a steady 0.007 amps

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Change <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>/11; maybe <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> too.

You can also try the trick to force 3v42 to pin 3.
In such case remove <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>; even R/<CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Only 2.6V with <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> removed

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> has been changed 4 times now, not sure if it needs to be changed again

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
"Only 2.6V with <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> removed"
You should bring 3V42 there...

Be aware, without <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>/11 charge may not power up the board.
Is better to let <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>/11 soldered and cut off trace to pin 3/<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Then bring 3V42 to ACIN pin.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
steady 3.4V on pin 3 ACIN pin now but  0V on pin 1

<CAPACITOR>C7185</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR> pad 1 18.5V but only 7.52V on pad 2

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
All these values are correct now.
What happens with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> now 0v

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Resistance to ground at L7130?
Post other voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; pins 2, 12, 13, 14, 9, 15, 17, 19, 20, 26, 27.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Do you get amber light on Magsafe?

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
0.7 L7130

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pin 2 18.25V pin 12 3,4V pin 13 3.2V pin 14 1.3V pin 9 0.36V pin 15 0V pin 17 1.75V pin 19 5.10V pin 20 5.10V pin 26 0V pin 27 0V

resistance 17/18   23   27/28   20.8

yes amber light on charger

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
"pin 14 1.3V
-----------------
pin 9 0.36V
--------------
pin 17 1.75V
------------
pin 27 0V
--------------
resistance 17/18 23"
All bad values.

Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and come back with news.
Also check <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81/85/86.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and checked <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81/85/86. All values are good.

pin 14 3.4V

pin 9 3.4V

pin 17 1.636V

pin 27 0v

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: resistance 17/18 1.320

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
"pin 9 3.4V"
This is the result of
"resistance 17/18 1.320"
So check <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>/51/52 and their traces to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: replaced and checked <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>/51/52 and checked traces. All are good but still same results

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: when checking <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> noticed have 0.003 short to ground. When <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is removed short is gone but once <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is replaced and soldered back on short returns.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: I've had one like this before. It could very well be an internal board short which would be hopeless :(

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Did you change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> with good one?
After change it, check diode mode on F7140 before powering the board.
As above mentioned, be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> traces.
Do NOT power untill check all traces OK.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
As far as I know <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> should be good. Pulled it from donar board,

0.141 diode mode now on F7140. All traces look good, no liquid damage on this board. History is store claimed board was working fine and that it just suddenly died.

Waiting for response if I should check anything else before I power board again

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Yes, checked traces with meter

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Check for short between <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> and L7130.
Be sure to have ALL traces good for <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL>; to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>, L/<TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
no short between <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> and L7130

All traces good for <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL>; to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>, L/<TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> currently .510V

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Post again voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Came back to this board.

Replaced <CHIP>ISL6250</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> again. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> fluctuates between 2-4V now

ISL measurements

Pin 2 18V

Pin 12 3.42V

Pin 13 1.30V

pin 14 0.882 V

pin 9 0.34V

pin 15 0.50V

pin 17 1.75V

pin 19 5V

pin 20 5V

pin 26 17.80V

pin 27 18V

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
"Pin 13 1.30V"
Are you sure?
It comes from <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, which is not present in such case; unless <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> is broken...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Pretty sure I killed the board by mistake. Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> since pin 1 was 0. Replacement <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> was not soldered properly and now there is a constant short to ground on  F7140 as soon as <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is soldered.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Remove F7140.
If short remains on L7130 side, then replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>.
Be sure to have good trace from pin1/<TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> to pin 24/<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
